name: Baubap
headline: Smart micro financing for everyone
description: Baubap is LatinAmerica's firts AI-powered, credit-focused bank. Today we're the leading AI lending app in Mexico

founders.name: Roberto Salcedo, Founder
founders.description: Cofounder and CEO at alternative lending fintech Baubap. Prior to founding Baubap, I was the CFO of a Mid Market Media Conglomerate with revenue >$100M and a Corporate Banking VP at Mexican Bank Invex. Earlier, I worked at HSBC where I designed and deployed the bank’s very first financial inclusion efforts 15 years ago to later be part of the Bank's Corporate Banking Executive Directory. Proud to hold a BA degree from UNAM and a Global Leadership diploma from Cambridge

founders.name: Luis Villarreal, Founder
founders.description:
Co-Founder and CTO @Baubap. Enthusiast and entrepreneur, passionate about helping people and making an impact in their life.
Building the bridge for financial freedom in Latin America.

generated_description:
Baubap is a fintech company based in Mexico City, proudly standing as Latin America's first AI-powered, credit-focused bank. Established in 2018, Baubap aims to democratize access to micro-financing with the mission of providing "Smart micro financing for everyone." It’s part of the Y Combinator Batch S21, a testament to its innovative approach and potential in the financial technology sector.

The company has quickly risen to become the leading AI lending app in Mexico, employing a team of around 150 people. Baubap’s app allows users to access instant loans ranging from **$500 to $5,000 MXN**, all without the need for credit history checks. This no-hassle approach means users can get approvals in under 10 minutes directly from their mobile phones. Their technology relies on smartphone data rather than traditional credit scores, marking a significant shift in how financial services can be accessed.

What really sets Baubap apart is its commitment to customer satisfaction and responsible lending practices. Their app boasts a 4.8-star rating on Google Play, reflecting positive user experiences. They offer various incentives, including cash rewards for paying loans on time and referring friends.

Nicolas Dessaigne serves as a Group Partner, and Baubap is tagged under the categories of 'machine-learning' and 'lending,' highlighting its tech-driven approach to personal finance. They operate within a legal framework as a SOFOM (a type of Mexican financial institution), ensuring that all practices are compliant with local regulations, which is crucial for building trust in an industry often marred by skepticism regarding financial institutions.

For more information about their services and how to apply for a loan, you can visit their website: [Baubap](https://www.baubap.com). In this era where technology and finance intersect, Baubap is carving out a niche that offers accessibility, speed, and a user-centric approach to lending.
